questions.question: What is the role of bicyclo[2.2.2]octane-1,4-dicarboxylic acid in the synthesis of NU-2200?
questions.answer: It serves as a three-dimensional linker to enhance structural stability and provide well-defined pore apertures/channels with sub-Ångstrom precision for the separation of hexane isomers.

questions.question: How does the incorporation of 3D linkers in NU-2200 contribute to its thermal stability?
questions.answer: The incorporation of 3D linkers increases structural rigidity, which contributes to NU-2200's enhanced thermal stability, allowing it to remain both crystalline and porous even at high temperatures.

questions.question: What is the significance of NU-2200's ability to separate hexane isomers?
questions.answer: NU-2200's ability to separate hexane isomers, including linear, monobranched, and dibranched isomers, represents a significant milestone in the field of non-thermal chemical separations, offering a potential solution for challenging separations in the petrochemical industry.

questions.question: Why was a 3D linker chosen over a 2D linker for the synthesis of NU-2200?
questions.answer: A 3D linker was chosen to reduce the flexible behavior and pore variation due to linker rotation and lack of steric hindrance in 2D linker-based MOFs, aiming for controlled pore size with sub-Ångstrom precision.

questions.question: How does the pore size of NU-2200 influence its separation performance for hexane isomers?
questions.answer: The precisely controlled pore size and limited flexibility of NU-2200 allow for the separation of hexane isomers based on their kinetic diameters, demonstrating high selectivity towards smaller and linear isomers.

questions.question: Is NU-2200 capable of maintaining its porosity and crystallinity at temperatures up to 400 °C?
questions.answer: True

questions.question: Does the synthesis of NU-2200 involve heating the mixture of zinc nitrate hexahydrate and BODCA in DMF at 120 °C for 24 hours?
questions.answer: True

questions.question: Can NU-2200 selectively separate dibranched isomers from monobranched and linear isomers in a mixture of all five C6 isomers?
questions.answer: False

questions.question: Is the BET area of NU-2200 less than 300 m2 g-1?
questions.answer: False

questions.question: Does NU-2200 demonstrate a Type-I isotherm characteristic of an ultramicroporous material?
questions.answer: True

questions.question: Is the thermal stability of NU-2200 solely attributed to its 3D linker structure?
questions.answer: False

questions.question: Can NU-2200 achieve separation of C6 isomers into linear, monobranched, and dibranched isomers at room temperature?
questions.answer: True

questions.question: What experimental techniques were used to confirm the permanent porosity of NU-2200?
questions.answer: Powder X-ray diffraction (PXRD) and N2 sorption measurements were used to confirm the permanent porosity of NU-2200.

questions.question: How does the presence of 3D linkers within NU-2200 minimize dynamic variation of pore aperture?
questions.answer: The presence of 3D linkers within NU-2200 minimizes dynamic variation of pore aperture due to linker rotation, which can hinder separation performance.

questions.question: What is the estimated size of the channel in NU-2200 from geometric consideration of the crystal structure?
questions.answer: The size of the channel in NU-2200 is estimated as 5 Å from geometric consideration of the crystal structure.

questions.question: What role does the zinc node play in the structure of NU-2200?
questions.answer: The zinc node is in a tetrahedral coordination sphere, bridged by the carboxylate groups from the linkers, forming one-dimensional chains that propagate along the c-axis.

questions.question: Is the synthesis of NU-2200 an example of solvothermal synthesis?
questions.answer: True

questions.question: Does NU-2200's ability to separate hexane isomers rely on the physical size differences between the isomers?
questions.answer: True

questions.question: Was the separation performance of NU-2200 for hexane isomers tested in both vapor and liquid phases?
questions.answer: The separation performance of NU-2200 for hexane isomers was tested using single-component sorption isotherms at 298 K and multicomponent batch liquid uptake experiments, indicating testing in both vapor and liquid phases.

questions.question: Is the thermal stability of NU-2200 under N2 higher than under air according to thermogravimetric analysis?
questions.answer: True
